## Flask Interview Questions

1. ##### Model-View-Controller

   Stands for "**Model-View-Controller**." MVC is an application design model comprised of three interconnected parts. They include the model (data), the view (user interface), and the controller (processes that handle input). The MVC model or "pattern" is commonly used for developing modern user interfaces.

   ![Image result for mvc full form](data:image/png;base64,)

2. **What Is Flask?**

   Flask is a web micro framework for Python based on “Werkzeug, Jinja 2 and good intentions” BSD licensed. Werkzeug and jingja are two of its dependencies.

3. **What Is The Benefit Of Using Flask?**

   Flask is part of the micro-framework. Which means it will have little to no dependencies on external libraries. It makes the framework light while there is little dependency to update and less security bugs.

4. **Explain How You Can Show All Errors In The Browser For The Flask?**

   To show all errors in the browser for the Flask, you need to run the Python file on the shell. The command used to see errors in detail is “app.debug = True”.

5. **What Is The Syntax Of A Decorator Used In Flask To Match Urls To View Functions In Flask Apps?**

   “@app.route” , the syntax is used in Flask to match URLs to view functions in Flask apps.

6. **What Is Flask Sijax?**

   Sijax is nothing but a Python/jQuery library to make Ajax easy to use in web applications. Sijax uses JSON to pass data between the server and the browser.
